data.title: New Api
data.body:
New Api: Reference::getcount()
New API:ImageTexture::load_image_buffer()
New Class ByteArray

data.title: Particles crash
data.body:
Godot crashes when particle amount is set to a high number (between 1000 and 1500) on both windows and linux:

ERROR: prepare: Condition ' p_system->amount<=0 || p_system->amount>=ParticleSystemSW::MAX_PARTICLES ' is true.
   At: servers/visual/particle_system_sw.cpp:288.

data.title: High editor CPU usage / spinner indicates constant redraw
data.body:
A few folk have indicated issues with the editor using high amount of CPU or at least having the window repaint spinner continuously turning. The cause of the redraw / updates is not clear and may not be consistent from user to user.

For me, the problem appeared sometime shortly after exporting a project for the first time. Deleting the created export.cfg file fixed the issue: I have git commits before and after with the only change being the deletion, and one exhibits the behaviour while the other does not.

data.title: Code editor issue
data.body:
To reproduce:

1) Open some code that fits in the window when editing.

2) Hit 'Run' - so that the debug window pops up on the bottom - the window with the code in must now be too small to contain the code, so the scroll bar appears.

3) Scroll to the bottom of the code, and put the cursor somewhere on-screen 

4) Hit 'Stop' - the scroll bar disappears and the mouse wheel is disabled, but not all the code is on-screen, the cursor must be moved using the arrow keys (or Page Up)

OK, so this sounds fussy.. but it IS a bug, and it keeps happening to me and its a bit annoying.

data.title: Contacts Reported in 3D Rigidbody
data.body:
'Contacts' data in 3D kinematic rigidbody seems to linger after a contact is destroyed. I can't be sure.. because its difficult to monitor at runtime. There should be a way to get the number of collided objects from RigidBody (like an get_contact_number() : int function). But I'm seeing odd behaviour when an object destroys itself inside a rigidbody set to 'kinematic' where the rb will not register any more contacts after it reaches the maximum set by the user. I'd expect 'freed' contacts to get cleaned up from the contact lists, but it SEEMS they don't.

Generally its quite important to me to have good 3D collision detection - without full physics simulation. After a lot of experimenting I'm finding the only way to achieve this in Godot is to use Rigidbodies set to 'Kinematic' and use signals to send a collision message to a suitable script elsewhere in the scenegraph.  There has to be a cleaner way.. I notice looking through the APi docs that 2D collision detection is quite well served in this regard. Any plans to extend the 3D collision detection system along similar lines?

data.title: Capsule CollisionShape
data.body: When I create a 3D collision object with a capsule collision shape. I am able to change the radius of the capsule, but not its length using the handles in the viewport.

data.title: New API: load_image_buffer
Xbox Input Mapping Incorrect
data.body: So as far as I can tell, Xbox controllers are supported just fine, but are mislabeled in the input map editor. The buttons don't correspond to the correct input listing, so if I assign jump to A on the Xbox controller, it won't actually be A. It's like start or something, I don't have it all mapped out but its definitely an issue.

data.title: Exporting Shape Settings to CollisionShape2D
data.body:
Hey there,
I have created a mockup for a simple ui enhancement. At the moment the shape settings are very hidden in the shape resource itself. You need to open the shaperesource to adjust the shape settings. It took me about 3 month to discover this. Before I always adjusted the shape via the nodes scale values, which resulted in very bad physics behavior.

In this screenshot I show how this can be exported to the main CollisionShape2D node. Depending on which shape is selected the appropriate shape values are shown.
I also thought if maybe removing the scale vector from that node, but I don't know if that should be done, or to just set it inactive or something like that.

![collisionshape_ui_enhancement](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6723918/2962884/4ad1e252-dad5-11e3-839b-66231c5a22d0.png)

data.title: Auto generate editor_icons.cpp to make it easy to update editor icons
data.body:
"editor_icons.cpp" need to be merged for every new added/modified icons, which is time consuming;
This patch make it auto generated in SCons build process.

data.title: IP.resolve_hostname() on Linux
data.body:
The call to IP.resolve_hostname always resolves to 127.0.0.1 on Linux. On Windows, it resolves to the "public" IP of the machine. This happens on Linux with both of these calls:

IP.resolve_hostname("localhost") = 127.0.0.1
IP.resolve_hostname("<machine_name>") = 127.0.0.1

on Windows, the result would be similar to:
IP.resolve_hostname("localhost") = 192,168.x.x (or the machine "public" IP)

Reference Forum Post: http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=582&p=2490#p2490

data.title: Add 'mesh/skeleton' property to MeshInstance
data.body:
-  to decouple mesh->skeleton from child parent constraint
- default to ".." for compatibility
- make swapping skeleton in run-time easier

data.title: File\Dir access and new API
[Question / Suggestion] How will bones work?
data.body: I know there is a skeleton object now, but I wonder if you guys are planning on changing it so each bone is an object inside that skeleton. I think that would be most useful for parenting objects to the bones, so I could attach a camera that follows the animations I gave the rig's head, or a sword to a hand, a rigid body to a bone, and any other useful thing that could be attach to a character rig (or other rigs).

data.title: Resolve issue #406 by adding hotkey for "quit to project manager"
data.body:
- Shift + Ctrl + Q or Shift + Command +Q to quit to project manager in editor
- Resolves issue #406 ( partially )

data.title: Use simple pattern '.METHOD' or 'METHOD(' to search method in Search Class Dialog
data.body:
e.g.

".collide" will match all methods start with "collide

"collide(" will match all methods end with "collide"

".collide(" will match exact method "collide"

data.title: Make String::right count from pos instead of pos+1
data.body:
- Change behavior of String:right to count from pos instead of pos+1

```
var s = "Godot"
print(s.right(2)) # return "dot" instead of "ot"
print(s.left(2), s.right(2)) # return "Godot" as usually expected, instead of "Goot"
```
- It might break existing script which reply on result from String::right

data.title: void Quat(Matrix3 from) not there?
data.body: void Quat(Matrix3 from): This constructor doesn't seem to work. It just returns like Quat(). I've checked the source in core/math/quat.h and there is apparently no such function implemented in c++.

data.title: [suggestion] Make pressing X in the editor quit to project menu
data.body: It would be nice if there were an easier way to return to the project selection menu than selecting Scene > Quit to Project Menu. Specifically, I sort of assumed that pressing the close window button would return to the project menu so I could select another project. I'd also be okay with a slightly more easily reachable shortcut to do this.

data.title: 2d nodes should have z property
data.body:
most other engines i have tried have this. They draw like godot, based on their position on the tree... but have separate drawing trees for every value of z... everything goes into the z=0 by default.

This allows to set what is on top of what easily. The workaround is use get_index and move_child... and raise... and it feels hackish at best

not sure how easy would be to implement because right now you only have to travel the scene tree once to draw, but sure would be nice for game developers (maybe automatically reorder the node tree based on z when something is added to it?)

data.title: [suggestion] editor eye should only apply to editor
data.body:
i would expect visible property and eye be independent of each other.

my use case:
im creating a nested menu where text on screen overlaps depending on what part of the nested menu you are in

Its hard to edit while debugging if you have to turn on and off visibility all the time on the different labels and controls

I might have everything hide but the subnested menu im editing, and when i run it for testing, i would like to respect the visibility property that i already had set

The workaround is set visibility of everything via code... but that defies the purpose of a nice editor, doesnt it? ;)

data.title: [crash] Segfault while attempting to play() a length-changed animation
data.body:
**Preamble**: crash seems to be caused by calling SomeAnimationNode.play("animation", -1, -1, false) to play an animation backwards when that animation has had its length changed. 

In my scenario, it was an animation that previously played fine forwards and backwards, but I shortened it to 1 second (from 10s). After this calling play() as above caused the segfault detailed below.   

Deleting and re-creating the animation solved the crash. I would speculate it may be related to similar occurences, such as physics bodies not colliding because the associated collision shape has been 'forgotten'; here recreating the shape also solves the issue.


data.title: assert keyword is not colorized in editor
data.body: this one should be easy :dancers:

data.title: godot and games, please respect xdg standard
data.body:
for ~/.godot and for games themselves

http://standards.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html

basically try to read a couple of env variables and if they are not set, default to ~/.config/

data.title: [linux] games automatically create folders in ~user/ even if they are not used
data.body:
This should be lazy initialization... and dont create the folder until is actually needed

Not sure if its used for .fscache (I dont see it there), but ~/.folders arent for cache files... either use /tmp or ~/.cache/

Either create folders or, since is a single file, rename .fscache to game.fscache to avoid collisions in the namespace

data.title: texture repeat setting ignored
data.body:
When I use a texture that's not imported, but referenced directly after I copy it into my resources directory, the repeat flag in the texture's settings will correctly make the texture repeat within the editor on a sprite with an oversized region setting.  However, when I launch the game with F5, the texture does not repeat.  If I save, close the editor and reopen the scene, the texture's repeat flag is no longer enabled.

Ubuntu 13.10, Godot v1.0.3917-beta1

data.title: New created export variable value get lost
data.body:
How to reproduce:
1. assign a script to a node, created a new export variable in the script

```
   export(int) var test_int
```
1. assign a value to new created variable, e.g. 100
2. save and reload the scene, find test_int in property inspector, it's 0 ( should be 100)

After the scene reloaded, the value will get serialized properly.

data.title: Fix LineEdit selected text drag and drop behavior
data.body:
- move selected text instead of duplicate them after drag and drop
- maintain selection after drop
